ref: 4595 catura2 ʻ *square ʼ, n. ʻ elephant stable ʼ lex., ˚rikā- f. ʻ square court ʼ Pañcad. [Cf. catvará -- . -- catur -- ]
Pk. caüraya -- m. ʻ meeting place in a village ʼ, ˚rī -- , ˚riyā -- f. ʻ wedding pavilion ʼ;
B. cori ʻ having four sloping roofs, quadrangular ʼ;
Or. caürā ʻ raised platform on which the Tulasī plant is worshipped ʼ, caürī ʻ courtyard surrounded by houses ʼ;
H. caurā m. ʻ place where satī is performed ʼ;
G. cɔrɔ m. ʻ village meeting place ʼ, cɔrī f. ʻ square enclosure in which marriage ceremony is performed ʼ.
